title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 2127/2001 of 29 October 2001 amending Regulation (EEC) No 391/92 setting the amounts of aid for the supply of cereals products from the Community to the French overseas departments
header:
Commission Regulation (EC) No 2127/2001
of 29 October 2001
amending Regulation (EEC) No 391/92 setting the amounts of aid for the supply of cereals products from the Community to the French overseas departments
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
recitals:
,
Having regard to the Treaty establishing the European Community,
Having regard to Council Regulation (EC) No 1452/2001 of 28 June 2001 introducing specific measures for certain agricultural products for the French overseas departments, amending Directive 72/462/EEC and repealing Regulations (EEC) No 525/77 and (EEC) No 3763/91 (Poseidom)(1), and in particular Article 3(6) thereof,
Whereas:
(1) The amounts of aid for the supply of cereals products to the French overseas departments (FOD) was settled by Commission Regulation (EEC) No 391/92(2), as last amended by Regulation (EC) No 1903/2001(3), as a consequence of the changes of the rates and prices for cereals products in the European part of the Community and on the world market, the aid for supply to the FOD should be set at the amounts given in the Annex.
(2) The measures provided for in this Regulation are in accordance with the opinion of the Management Committee for Cereals,
main_body: The Annex to amended Regulation (EEC) No 391/92 is replaced by the Annex to this Regulation.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 1 November 2001.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 29 October 2001.
For the Commission
Franz Fischler
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ L 198, 21.7.2001, p. 11.
(2) OJ L 43, 19.2.1992, p. 23.
(3) OJ L 261, 29.9.2001, p. 14.
ANNEX
to the Commission Regulation of 29 October 2001 amending Regulation (EEC) No 391/92 setting the amounts of aid for the supply of cereals products from the Community to the French overseas departments
